content.user_title: Apply Zustand patterns for React Native
content.value_statement: Zustand state management in React Native has subtle timing behaviors that cause hard-to-debug issues. This skill provides proven patterns to handle synchronous set() calls, avoid stale closures in async operations, and implement reliable store subscriptions.
actual_capabilities: Explain set() synchronous behavior versus React render batching
Prevent stale closures in async store actions using get()
Implement proper async actions with try/catch and state checks
Optimize selectors to avoid unnecessary re-renders
Create store subscriptions for side effects outside components
Debug state changes with devtools middleware and logging
limitations: Does not generate complete store implementations from requirements
Does not test or validate existing Zustand code
Does not provide runtime performance profiling
Does not cover non-React Native Zustand usage patterns

use_cases.title: Debug state timing issues
use_cases.description: Understand why set() updates state immediately but components show old values until re-render

use_cases.title: Fix async action bugs
use_cases.description: Implement async store actions that correctly read state after await without stale closure problems

use_cases.title: Optimize store subscriptions
use_cases.description: Set up reactive side effects that trigger on specific state changes outside React components

prompt_templates.title: Understanding set()
prompt_templates.prompt: Explain why set() is synchronous but my React Native component still shows the old value after calling set(). Include how to verify the actual state immediately after set().

prompt_templates.title: Fixing stale closures
prompt_templates.prompt: Show me how to fix stale closure issues in my Zustand store when I have async callbacks. After await operations, how do I ensure I am reading the current state?

prompt_templates.title: Async action patterns
prompt_templates.prompt: Write a pattern for a Zustand async action that properly handles loading state, errors, and ensures the caller can await the result. Include race condition protection.

prompt_templates.title: Selector optimization
prompt_templates.prompt: My Zustand selectors are causing too many re-renders in my React Native app. Show me how to use shallow comparison and multiple selectors to optimize performance.

output_examples.input: Why does my component show stale data after calling set() in my Zustand store?
output: set() updates state synchronously, but React re-renders are batched asynchronously
getState() immediately reflects the new value (use for verification)
Components only update on the next render cycle
After await in async functions, always use get() instead of closure-captured values
For immediate reads outside components, use useStore.getState()

output_examples.input: How do I set up a store subscription for analytics outside my components?
output: Use useStore.subscribe() with a selector for the specific state you want to track
The callback receives both current and previous state for comparison
Add equalityFn (like shallow) to prevent unnecessary callbacks
Return an unsubscribe function to clean up when no longer needed
Useful for analytics, logging, persistence, or syncing with other systems

best_practices: Always use get() or getState() after any await to avoid stale closures
Use shallow comparison for object selectors to prevent unnecessary re-renders
Implement subscribe() for side effects that should run outside React components
anti_patterns: Relying on closure-captured state after async operations without re-reading with get()
Returning non-Promise results from async actions that callers try to await
Creating new objects in selectors without shallow comparison, causing excessive re-renders

faq.question: What Zustand versions does this skill cover?
faq.answer: Covers both Zustand 4.x and 5.x, including migration notes for shallow comparison and useShallow hook differences.

faq.question: Can I use these patterns in plain React?
faq.answer: Yes, most patterns apply to React web apps. Only React Native specific debugging tools differ.

faq.question: Does this skill write code to my project?
faq.answer: No, this skill provides patterns and guidance. It does not modify files or execute code.

faq.question: How do I test Zustand stores?
faq.answer: Add a reset action to your store, call getState() to access store methods directly, and reset state before each test.

faq.question: What causes selectors to trigger extra re-renders?
faq.answer: Returning new object instances from selectors breaks reference equality. Use shallow comparison or split into multiple selectors.

faq.question: How is this different from Redux patterns?
faq.answer: Zustand avoids boilerplate but requires understanding its synchronous set() behavior versus asynchronous React renders. No middleware chain exists.
